did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Environmental Health and Safety HazMat Shipping Manifests
did.abstract: Shipping manifests and administrative files related to the removal of hazardous material and waste on the WSU Pullman campus from 1995-2008.

bioghist.p: Environmental Health and Safety is a non-academic service department dedicated to promoting and supporting the university’s efforts to protect human health, safety and the environment.

scopecontent.p: Primarily consists of shipping manifests and other administrative forms related to the removal of hazardous waste on the WSU campuses from 1995-2008.
An itemized list of the contents of this collection can be found online here.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.

All boxes contain shipping manifest and reports related to hazardous material waste. Box 1 contains manifests from 2006-2008. Box 2 contains manifests from 1995-1996. Box 3 contains manifests from 1997-1999. Box 4 contains manifests from 1998-2002. Box 5 contains manifests from 2004-2005. All files are separated into folders that are ordered by shipment number and date.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Environmental Health and Safety HazMat Shipping Manifests, 1995-2008 (UA2013-01)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Ade Snider of Environmental Health and Safety on January 04, 2013 and retained as UA2013-01.

processinfo.p: (MASC STAFF USE) Not to be processed; simply hold until end of retention perion.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
